title: Why are Russians leaving Central Asia? - Quora

response.answer_text: As mentioned previously but in a nicer tone, there are less opportunities available than before. The Stans favor their own over Russians. They are also pushing the national language over Russian and many Russians never bothered to learn the national language. The opportunities are shrinking for Russians. I had a Russian tell me that he was fired after he had trained an Uzbek on what the job entailed.

Because its becoming harder and requiring people to work more in order to live comfortably. Slavics are leaving because its getting harder for them to get jobs as they never learned the national language and they demand more from government rather than contributing.
